column4: can anyone help me with setting up xorg with the nvidia drivers?  i try to run 1280x1024 and it just wont work, but before i use the nvidia drivers it works fine in that resolution
pastebin your xorg.conf file
http://pastebin.com/575926
sudo ddcprobe | grep monitorrange
monitorrange: 31-70, 55-120
replace it with this: http://pastebin.com/575934
your monitor rates were really weird
well i will go and try this right now, if it doesnt work i will be back... if it does i will again be back (to thank you of course)
see you soon :)

well at least x got up again with the new config.  when at gdm the screen was too large for the monitor so it decided to scroll.  now in gnome my resolution is 1280x960.  this the the problem that i always have when using the nvidia drives.... what is up with them?
sys>pref>screen res.
can you choose 1280x1024?
i did have it working once with the nvidia drivers.  but unfortunately i was on gentoo and then the drive crashed
no i cannot.
having an ati card ... i'm deferring to nvidia owners. sorry. :-/
well thankyou for the help.  i just dont understand what this drivers problem is
now worries.  good luck
well i know that i am not in the minority because a search for the problem on google will return alot of results
would this line help at all do you think? Modeline "1280x1024" 109.62  1280 1336 1472 1720  1024 1024 1026 1062
that's your modelin?  yes.  that is weird
it should be Modeline "res" "res" "res"
well no i just used an online modeline generator.  i am shooting in the dark when it comes to x
actually the modeline should follow the format in here: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/FixVideoResolutionHowto
